content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-024-24-A |Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy. |Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy. |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the work-up for fever during pregnancy |Description=Biologies and complementary examinations according to clinical examination |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle |Order=24}} In all cases, we will carry out : - ECBU - ''NFS - CRP - blood cultures (if fever > 38.5°C with search for Listeria M) - serologies according to context (rubella, toxoplasmosis, hepatitis, CMV, HIV, PB19) - Others according to signs of orientation: PCR (COVID), rapid influenza test, streto test, etc. - RCF and tocometry - obstetrical ultrasound: EPF, foetal well-being and amount of LA. question.title: What is the recommended work-up for fever during pregnancy?
question.description: Biologies and complementary examinations according to clinical examination

option_a.title: ECBU, NFS, blood cultures, and serologies
option_a.description: A comprehensive approach to diagnosing fever during pregnancy

option_b.title: ECBU, blood cultures, and PCR
option_b.description: A focused approach to diagnosing fever during pregnancy

option_c.title: ECBU, NFS, and tocometry
option_c.description: A specialized approach to diagnosing fever during pregnancy

option_d.title: ECBU, blood cultures, and obstetrical ultrasound
option_d.description: A combination of diagnostic approaches to assess fetal well-being
